title: JSON-RPC window fully occupied by the results of a previous command
body:
# Bug Report

## Description

After running one JSON-RPC command, I cannot run another one (without relaunching Status Desktop), because the results of the first command occupy the prompt window, and there is no obvious way to remove them.

![Screenshot from 2023-11-15 13-05-23](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/7126627/26720f75-3aed-4e9b-989f-fcc406c544d7)
![Screenshot from 2023-11-15 12-24-13](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/7126627/dfee26cd-f877-4894-b272-b9a5f9899eda)


## Steps to reproduce

1. Select Node Management in the left pane.
2. Scroll down to "Use this tool to call JSONRPC methods"
3. Run any method in the following window, for example: `{"method":"wakuext_peers"}`

#### Expected behavior

I can input the next command after the results of the first command.

#### Actual behavior

The results of the first command occupy the window and provide no space for the following command.

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: Current version 0.9.90, Status Go version 0.171.12
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS
